[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [General] [Rc<RefCell<>> safety] Throughout the file, values use Rc<RefCell<>> for interior mutability - can attackers trigger RefCell borrow panics by creating nested borrows, causing validator crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [General] [Gas metering gaps] The tests don't verify gas charges - can attackers exploit expensive value operations (deep struct nesting, large vectors) to perform computation without paying proportional gas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [General] [Serialization consistency] Tests don't verify that values serialize/deserialize consistently across validators - can non-deterministic serialization cause state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [General] [Resource semantics] Tests don't explicitly verify resource drop/move semantics - can attackers violate resource uniqueness by duplicating values through unsafe operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [General] [Error propagation] Many operations return PartialVMResult - if errors are not properly propagated, can failed operations leave values in inconsistent states? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [General] [Value depth limits] The file imports DEFAULT_MAX_VM_VALUE_NESTED_DEPTH but tests don't verify enforcement - can attackers create values exceeding depth limits causing stack overflow? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: struct_pack_and_unpack()] [u8 overflow] When packing u8(10) at line 48, does the implementation prevent values >255? Can overflow during arithmetic operations cause incorrect state transitions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: struct_pack_and_unpack()] [u16 boundary] u16(12) at line 49 - are boundary values (0, 65535) handled correctly in all operations? Can edge values trigger unexpected behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: struct_pack_and_unpack()] [u32 arithmetic] u32(15) at line 50 - does u32 arithmetic properly prevent overflow in balance calculations? Can attackers exploit overflow to mint unlimited tokens? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: struct_pack_and_unpack()] [u64 wrap-around] u64(20) at line 51 - does wrapping arithmetic get used anywhere? Can attackers exploit wrap-around in timestamp or nonce calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: struct_pack_and_unpack()] [u128 precision] u128(30) at line 52 - for token amounts using u128, can precision loss during division cause rounding errors that accumulate to significant fund loss? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: struct_pack_and_unpack()] [u256 max value] U256::MAX at line 53 - does using maximum values cause overflow in arithmetic, comparison, or hashing operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: test_mem_swap()] [Signed integer handling] The test includes i8, i16, i32, i64, i128, i256 values but doesn't test negative numbers - can negative value handling have vulnerabilities in comparison or arithmetic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: struct_borrow_field()] [Reference count overflow] When repeatedly borrowing the same field (lines 83, 88, 93), can the reference count overflow causing the count to wrap to 0, allowing the value to be dropped while references exist? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: struct_borrow_nested()] [Nested reference cycles] In deeply nested borrows (r1→r2→r3), can circular references prevent proper cleanup, causing memory leaks that exhaust validator memory over time? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: locals()] [Drop safety] After move_loc() at line 32, is the moved value properly dropped? Can resources be leaked without calling proper cleanup code? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [General] [Transaction abort handling] If a transaction aborts mid-execution, are all value modifications rolled back atomically? Can partial state updates cause validator state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [General] [Parallel execution safety] For Block-STM parallel execution, can concurrent transactions access overlapping value references causing race conditions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: global_value_non_struct()] [Global storage consistency] When GlobalValue operations fail (lines 138-144), is global storage left in a consistent state or can failed operations corrupt storage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: test_vector_unchecked()] [Generic type parameters] When creating vectors of generic types, does type parameter substitution work correctly? Can attackers exploit type parameter confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: struct_pack_and_unpack()] [Struct field type variance] Can struct fields be covariant or contravariant in their types? Can this cause type unsoundness allowing violation of type safety? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [General] [Invalid value state] The Value enum has an Invalid variant - when does this get used? Can attackers trigger Invalid state in valid execution paths causing undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: struct_borrow_field()] [Bool value validation] When writing Value::bool(true) at line 89, does it validate that the underlying byte is 0 or 1? Can attackers create invalid bool values causing logic errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/values/value_tests.rs] [Function: test_mem_swap()] [Bool vector operations] Vector<bool> operations - does bool packing optimize for space? Can bit-level operations cause race conditions or corruption? (Low)
